title: Fun Art Show for Bridget Riley
summary: A new art exhibit is open at the Turner Contemporary gallery in Kent, England. It shows paintings by Bridget Riley, a famous British artist who is 94 years old. The exhibit has her art from the 1960s, recent wall paintings, and new canvases. It is called Learning to See and is free to visit until May 4th. The curator, Melissa Blanchflower, says it is special to see the art in person. She worked closely with Riley and learned more about her work. The gallery also has drawing classes inspired by Riley for people to join. This is a great chance to enjoy colorful and exciting art.

background_read: Bridget Riley is a famous artist from England known for her colorful and patterned paintings that can make your eyes feel like they are moving. She started making art a long time ago and is still creating today. An art gallery is a place where people can go to see art for free or sometimes pay a little money. Curators help choose which art to show and make sure everything looks nice. This exhibit lets people see how Riley's art has changed over many years.
Article_Structure: WHO: Bridget Riley, the artist, and Melissa Blanchflower, the curator
WHAT: An art exhibit showing Riley's paintings from different times
WHERE: Turner Contemporary gallery in Kent, England
WHY: To let people see and experience Riley's art in person and learn from it

perspectives.description: Bridget Riley might want people to enjoy the colors and patterns in her art and feel inspired.
Melissa Blanchflower thinks it is important for people to see the art up close to understand it better.
